CatDescriptText: Mrs. Iris Williams, housewife, 3202 Dawson Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: �No, I don�t.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Iris Williams, wearing light colored zippered jacket with plush collar, dark gloves, and light colored patterned head scarf, carrying dark rectangular handbag, holding hand of child wearing light colored double breasted coat, standing in front of flecked granite facade
